sentences: Taylor Dayne (born Leslie Wunderman; March 7, 1962) is an American singer, songwriter, and actress.
section: N/A

sentences: She rose to fame in 1987 after her debut single "Tell It to My Heart".
section: N/A

sentences: Dayne achieved six additional U.S. top-10 singles, including "Love Will Lead You Back", "Prove Your Love", and "I'll Always Love You".
section: N/A

sentences: Dayne has received two Grammy Award nominations, and has won an American Music Award, and multiple New York Music Awards.
section: N/A

sentences: She has also received New York Hall of Fame honors and was ranked number 18 on Rolling Stone's list of the best female dance artists of all time.
section: N/A

sentences: Leslie Wunderman was born in Manhattan, New York City, New York, United States, and lived briefly in another borough, The Bronx, until her family moved to Long Island when she was two years old.
section: == Singing and acting career == | === Early success ===

sentences: She began singing professionally after graduating from high school in Baldwin, Nassau County, New York, singing in little-known rock bands such as Felony and Next.
section: == Singing and acting career == | === Early success ===

sentences: She began singing solo after finishing college and, under the name Les Lee, recorded two dance singles, "I'm The One You Want" (1985) and "Tell Me Can You Love Me" (1986), which were released on New York indie label Mega Bolt.
section: == Singing and acting career == | === Early success ===

sentences: Signed to Arista Records as Taylor Dayne, her first song to crack the top ten was the dance-pop hit "Tell It to My Heart" in late 1987.
section: == Singing and acting career == | === Early success ===

sentences: The song was an instant smash worldwide, peaking in the top five of most major markets worldwide, and reaching number one in many countries, including West Germany.

sentences: Six more U.S. top-ten hits followed, including "Prove Your Love", "I'll Always Love You", "Don't Rush Me", "With Every Beat of My Heart", "Love Will Lead You Back" and "I'll Be Your Shelter".

sentences: These were followed by the No. 12 hit "Heart of Stone".

sentences: "I'll Always Love You," a change-of-pace ballad compared to Dayne's earlier releases, was her breakout hit on the Adult Contemporary charts in 1988 and paved the way for future uptempo dance tracks such as "Don't Rush Me" (1988) and "With Every Beat Of My Heart" (1989) to gain acceptance on Adult Contemporary radio.
section: == Singing and acting career == | === Early success ===

sentences: In 1990, "Love Will Lead You Back", a Diane Warren composition, peaked at No. 1 on both the Billboard Hot 100 and the Hot Adult Contemporary Tracks chart.

sentences: The string of hits from her first two albums, Tell It to My Heart (1988) and Can't Fight Fate (1989), proved to be the peak of her career.

sentences: She went on to release two more albums in the 1990s, but had only one more U.S. Top 40 hit, her 1993 cover of Barry White's 1974 hit "Can't Get Enough of Your Love" (from her 1993 album Soul Dancing), which reached No. 2 in the ARIA Charts in Australia but only No. 20 in the U.S.

== Personal life ==

sentences: Personal life ==
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Dayne has never married.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: She has two children, who were born via a surrogate.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Dayne is a supporter of same-sex marriage, and stated in 2014 that she considers the LGBT community to be her most loyal fanbase.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Dayne is Jewish.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: She grew up in Baldwin and Freeport, New York, on Long Island.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In 2021, after performing at a New Year party hosted at Mar-a-Lago by then-current President of the United States, Donald Trump, Dayne declared "I try to stay non-political."
